page.title: 06BERKELEY VALE ARABLE FARMING
page.content: The basic types of{arable farming}in Berkeley Vale are{barley, wheat}and {oats.}The high yielding corn needs careful tending with well broken up soil and sprays for weeds, disease and pests which this type of corn is not hardy enough to withstand. The weather plays a crucial role in{crop yields}as this summers poor harvest has shown. {Marketing outlets}are bakeries, animal feed producers and seed merchants. As has happened with milk,{quotas}look like coming in to control the over production of cereals, despite this years crop. Much of the work done on the local arable farms is becoming more {mechanised,}which is resulting in{less {farm work for local people.}One area of expansion is in{computerised maintenance and control of farms requiring more specialised staff.
